message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

This paper deals with contextualized word embeddings, which are widely used in natural language processing (NLP) tasks such as sentence classification and language inference. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which focuses on NLP and related areas. The paper also proposes a method for retrofitting word embeddings, which involves learning an orthogonal transformation on the input space. This suggests that the paper may also be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), which deal with machine learning and optimization techniques. Finally, the paper evaluates its method on sentence classification tasks, which may also make it relevant to cs.CV (Computer Vision), which deals with image and video analysis, but also includes tasks such as image captioning and visual question answering that involve natural language processing.
